thread.title: GREENCASTLE-ANTRIM ROUNDUP: Field hockey, volleyball pick up wins; boys' soccer falls to Camp Hill
thread.title_full: GREENCASTLE-ANTRIM ROUNDUP: Field hockey, volleyball pick up wins; boys' soccer falls to Camp Hill

title: GREENCASTLE-ANTRIM ROUNDUP: Field hockey, volleyball pick up wins; boys' soccer falls to Camp Hill
text: GREENCASTLE-ANTRIM ROUNDUP: Field hockey, volleyball pick up wins; boys' soccer falls to Camp Hill Comment   Writer Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 10:15 AM Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 10:15 AM FIELD HOCKEY Blue Devils defeat Bishop McDevitt GREENCASTLE — Lauren Cole scored off an assist from Sabrina Martin 12 minutes into the second half, lifting Greencastle-Antrim to a 1-0 victory over Bishop McDevitt Tuesday evening at Kaley Field. “Tonight was a fairly evenly played game, neither team sustained much offensive possession,” G-A coach Becca Farson said. “Lauren was instrumental in getting us into the circle numerous times and took control of the ball down the field to score the lone goal of the game. Emily Bland once again keyed a strong defensive effort in front of the cage.” The Blue Devils (8-6-1) held a 7-2 advantage in shots and a 7-3 edge in corners. Mackenzie Oberholzer registered two saves to preserve the shutout. Following Tuesday’s win, G-A sits 16th in the current District 3-AA power ratings used to determined postseason qualifiers. The top-20 will advance. The Blue Devils return to action Thursday at home against Boiling Springs before heading to Big Spring for a make-up game on Saturday. BOYS’ SOCCER G-A falls to Camp Hill in final seconds CAMP HILL — In a showdown of two emerging contenders, Camp Hill scored the game-winning goal with 30 seconds remaining in regulation Tuesday night, defeating Greencastle-Antrim 2-1. Seemingly headed for overtime, Adam Jones found the back of the net for the Lions, snapping G-A’s four game winning streak. Austyn Smith opened the scoring for the Blue Devils (13-4) less than three minutes in before Camp Hill immediately answered, tying the game at the 4:29 mark of the first half. The back-and-forth contest unfolded from there, culminating in Jones’ game-winner for Camp Hill, which improved to 14-1 on the year. “We scored early and tried to take the momentum right away, but then we gave one up two minutes later, which hurt,” G-A coach Scott Gelsinger said. “Then to give up the game-winner with 30 seconds left is tough. They’re a very good team that found a way to get it done.” Still comfortably in position to qualify for the District 3 playoffs, Greencastle concludes its regular season schedule at Carlisle on Saturday. GIRLS’ VOLLEYBALL Blue Devils sweep Boiling Springs BOILING SPRINGS — Greencastle-Antrim cruised to a Mid-Penn Capital Division sweep of Boiling Springs Tuesday night, earning wins of 25-17, 25-15 and 25-14. Keri Gearhart led the way for the Blue Devils (10-6, 8-3 MPC-Capital), connecting on a match-high 13 kills. Elizabeth Dagliano added eight kills and 12 digs while Rachel Verhoef (7 kills) and Jess Root (6 kills) were frequently involved in the offensive attack. Page 2 of 2 - Kirti Venkatesh dished out 33 assists in the victory. G-A returns to action Thursday evening at home for a marquee Capital Division contest against unbeaten Waynesboro.   Writer
